intro: Urtica scabra, commonly known as stinging nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its hollow,螫刺 (stinging) hairs that release an irritant when touched, causing a burning sensation on the skin. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along roadsides. Urtica scabra is also known for its nutritional value, containing high levels of protein, minerals, and vitamins.
